data.title: GPC® MiraCopper® , Aquamulsion® Positive Resist Coated

description.text:
GPC® MiraCopper®, AquaMulsion® Positive Resist Coated plates are some of the best in the industry. AquaMulsion Positive Resist is formulated to work with our GPC AquaMulsion Positive Developer, a special water soluble developer.

UEI has worked to overcome the challenges that positive resists traditionally had in the past. AquaMulsion Positive Resist Coated Plates offer exceptional resolution and the fine line capabilities you expect from a positive resist coating. Both our positive and negative resist coated plates can handle resolutions up to 25,000 lines per inch, and both have a coated shelf life of 1 year!

These products have Perfect Parallelism with +/- .0004"/.010mm.

data.title: GPC® MiraCopper® , Aquamulsion® Negative Resist Coated

description.text:
GPC® MiraCopper®, AquaMulsion® Negative Resist Coated plates are some of the best in the industry. AquaMulsion Negative Resist is formulated to work with our GPC AquaMulsion Negative Developer, a special water soluble developer.

UEI constantly works to improve our product quality. Unlike many negative resist plates on the market, our negative resist plates can hold fine line resolutions equally as well as positive resist plates! All our coated plates can handle resolutions up to 25,000 lines per inch. And with UEI’s AquaMulsion coated plates, you no longer have to worry about short shelf lives. Our negative resist coated plates have a coated shelf life of 1 year!

These products have Perfect Parallelism with +/- .0004"/.010mm.
For all your specialized needs, UEI also offers our same quality copper plates in an raw (uncoated) version.
sizes:
Available in the following Sizes:

18" x 18" x .276" (457.2mm x 457.2mm x 7mm)
18" x 36" x .276" (457.2mm x 914.4mm x 7mm)
18" x 36" x .0625" (16 gauge) (457.2mm x 914.4mm x 1.59mm)
18" x 18" x .0625" (16 gauge) (457.2mm x 457.2mm x 1.59mm)

description.text: Our combo sink is specially designed for developing exposed coated plates. The combo sink evenly sprays AquaMulsion® developer over the entire surface of the plate to produce a consistently developed plate that’s ready to be etched.

GPC® AquaMulsion® Positive Developer is specially designed to work with our GPC® AquaMulsion® Positive resist coated plates.

Unlike traditional developers which contained harsh solvents, AquaMulsion® developer is composed of a mild alkaline solution which reacts with components on the plate. Our developer is safer for you and the environment.

*Due to Transportation Regulations this product will only be shipped via FedEx®, Motor Freight or Ocean Freight.

GPC® AquaMulsion® Positive Developer is specially designed to work with our GPC® AquaMulsion® Positive resist coated plates.

Unlike traditional developers which contained harsh solvents, AquaMulsion® developer is composed of a mild alkaline solution which reacts with components on the plate. Our developer is safer for you and the environment.

*Due to Transportation Regulations this product will only be shipped via FedEx®, Motor Freight or Ocean Freight.

The Film Sensitivity Scale is used to check the exposure of coated plates. This industry standard scale is made of a reusable piece of translucent film.

These handy disposable wipes are soft, gentle, absorbent low-lint wipes for light-duty tasks. They easily pick up liquid and dust without scratching fragile surfaces. These economical task wipers are non-abrasive and are considered safe for use on most delicate surfaces. Made from 100% virgin wood fiber.

Para Paque Markers are fast drying and waterproof. High Density ensures complete light blockage. The push and flow point allows the proper amount of ink to move into the point. Super density means that one application will cover completely and the ink dries in just seconds. Perfect for film or photo negatives.
sizes:
Available in the following Sizes:

Fine tip
Broad tip

description.text: A fine point paint brush, perfect for touch-ups to plates before etching.
Sharp disposable blades fit into standard tool handle for small detail cutting. They are utilized in hand-trimming process of make-ready procedure. (100 per box)
sizes:
Available in the following sizes:

Pointed tip
Flat tip

description.text: Solid clear plastic triangle. 30/60 Degrees, 18" (457.2mm).

The perfect measuring tool, this durable clear plastic ruler allows you to see the object you are measuring through the ruler resulting in exceptionally precise measurements. 18" long (457.2 mm), includes inches and centimeters.
This is an affordable professional loupe, perfect for careful examination of fine details in engravings, press proofs or any other object.

The GPC® Digital Copper Analyzer measures the amount of copper in a ferric chloride etch bath. Checking your etch bath with the digital copper analyzer is faster and easier than weighing plates before and after etching. Comes with a sturdy plastic carrying case, 6 glass sample jars and a standard AC adapter.

When ordering this product, IS-PRO1673, IS-PRO3472, IS-PRO1674, IR-CHE7469 & IS-PRO3469 are also needed.
Use this sturdy Pyrex tool to measure the density of ferric chloride to ensure that you have the correct concentrations for etching. Uses a Baume scale.

A Depth Gauge accurately measures etching and engraving depth on dies. Simple and quick to use, this tool is indispensable for checking that a consistent depth is being achieved. Comes with a sturdy plastic storage case.

GPC® etching scales are used to measure the quantity of additives present in your etch bath. Using the etching scales will allow you to determine the correct amount of GPC® Stabilizer to add to your etch bath to achieve a stabilized bath. A stabilized bath will etch plates with a correct bevel, and avoid undercutting the image. (48 etching scales per plate)

Our GPC® Calibrated Ferric Chloride is specially formulated to be the most versatile and simple to use copper etching bath on the market today! It can be used for a wide variety of etching uses – half tones, bold and fine lines, deep and shallow etching. With GPC® Calibrated Ferric Chloride, you can etch all these in one bath, with no need to reformulate the bath for each type of etching. We’ve taken the guesswork out of etching for you.
GPC® Uncalibrated 30 degree Baume Ferric Chloride contains no copper or additives. It is intended for controlled etching, and special applications. It can also be used for etching brass.

Over time, the additives in an etch bath necessary to maintain the angle of the bevel will break down and need to be replenished. GPC® Stabilizer is pre-measured and pre-mixed to allow you to quickly and easily stabilize your calibrated ferric chloride etching bath.

*Due to Transportation Regulations this product will only be shipped via FedEx®, Motor Freight or Ocean Freight.

Over time, the additives in an etch bath necessary to maintain the angle of the bevel will break down and need to be replenished. GPC® Stabilizer is pre-measured and pre-mixed to allow you to quickly and easily stabilize your calibrated ferric chloride etching bath.

*Due to Transportation Regulations this product will only be shipped via FedEx®, Motor Freight or Ocean Freight.

*Due to Transportation Regulations this product will only be shipped via FedEx®, Motor Freight or Ocean Freight.

Reusable bit for use with air grinders or electric grinders. Attach replaceable sanding disks to the holder for precision sanding of small areas.

Sanding Disks are great multi-purpose tools. They are useful for smoothing sculptured brass dies, especially on flat areas of the die. Sanding Disks are also ideal for removing CNC tool marks on dies. For hand finishing, they are great for sculpting, blending and deburring holes and edges. Used with an air grinder or electric grinder. Available in a variety of sizes and grits for a wide variety of applications.

This wooden handle securely holds a variety of knife tools for hand engraving. It is designed to be comfortable to hold and easy to grip for precision work.
Metal blade for making your own hand engraving tool. Sharpen the knife blade and insert into wooden tool handle to create a versatile tool for precision hand engraving brass plates.
Comfortable head-unit for hands-free magnification. Great for working on those fine detail projects for an extended period of time.
Handy replacement lens for Optivisors. Great if lenses become scratched or stained.

The same resist that we use on our coated metal is also available in a bottle. AquaMulsion® Positive Photoresist is a necessary product for double etch processes, such as refractive etching. AquaMulsion® Positive Resist is formulated to work with our GPC® AquaMulsion® Positive Developer, a special water soluble developer.

UEI has worked to overcome the challenges that positive resists traditionally have had in the past. AquaMulsion® Positive Resist Coatings aren’t brittle or tricky to work with, and still maintain the exceptional resolution and fine line capabilities you expect from a positive resist.

Both our positive and negative resists can handle resolutions up to 25,000 lines per inch and have a 1 year shelf life in the bottle. They are ideally formulated for a spray coat process. Contact us for information on formulating photoresist for roller coating.

The same resist that we use on our coated metal is also available in a bottle. AquaMulsion® Negative Photoresist is a necessary product for double etch processes, such as refractive etching. ® Negative Resist is formulated to work with our GPC® AquaMulsion® Negative Developer, a special water soluble developer.

UEI constantly works to improve our product quality. Unlike many negative resists on the market, our negative resist can hold fine line resolutions equally as well as positive resists!

All our coated plates can handle resolutions up to 25,000 lines per inch. And with UEI’s AquaMulsion® coated plates, you no longer have to worry about short shelf lives. Our negative resist coated plates have a coated shelf life of 1 year!

Our AquaMulsion® Negative Photoresist is ideally formulated for a spray coat process. Contact us for information on formulating photoresist for roller coating.

data.title: GPC® Block Out Liquid

description.text: Using GPC® Block Out Liquid will significantly extend the life of your etch bath. Before etching, cover large open areas on your plate with block out liquid. After etching, these areas can be milled away. Block out liquid can also be used for fine-line touch ups to plates before etching – apply with a paint brush.

data.priceType: Price Per Jar, 250 ml, 8.453 fluid ounces

description.text: Using GPC® Block Out Marker will significantly extend the life of your etch bath. Before etching, cover large open areas on your plate with block out. After etching, these areas can be milled away. The Block Out Marker makes applying block out quick and easy, and ensures even coverage. It also reduces clean-up time. No messy paintbrushes to wash!
Our 20/40 etching machine is one of the best etching machines in the industry. Perfect for larger sheet sizes, it consistently creates the finest etched plates available.
High-quality Pyrex graduated cylinder, perfect for precisely measuring a variety of liquids.

Antifoam ensures that uniform etching will not be hindered by foam building up in the etch bath. Quickly and easily controls foam, without impairing etching quality.

Comes with 1 eye dropper and 1 - 4oz bottle.
